publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2454 Trish Godman: Retirement of John Hume and Seamus Mallonâ€”That the Parliament notes the retirement of John Hume and Seamus Mallon from the leadership of the Social Democratic and Labour Party; acknowledges the supremely important part which they have both played in the Northern Ireland peace process and, in particular, in the creation of the Northern Ireland Assembly and the new police service; believes that they are amongst the finest and most honourable politicians of their generation; pays handsome tribute to their remarkable political abilities and unflinching personal courage in the face of brutal adversity, and believes that their sustained and deep opposition to all kinds of violence should guide the conduct of all present and future political activists in democracies throughout the world.

S1M-2454 Trish Godman: Retirement of John Hume and Seamus Mallon-That the Parliament notes the retirement of John Hume and Seamus Mallon from the leadership of the Social Democratic and Labour Party; acknowledges the supremely important part which they have both played in the Northern Ireland peace process and, in particular, in the creation of the Northern Ireland Assembly and the new police service; believes that they are amongst the finest and most honourable politicians of their generation; pays handsome tribute to their remarkable political abilities and unflinching personal courage in the face of brutal adversity, and believes that their sustained and deep opposition to all kinds of violence should guide the conduct of all present and future political activists in democracies throughout the world. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson*
S1M-2454 Retirement of John Hume and Seamus Mallon (lodged on 15 November 2001) Robin Harper*
S1M-2454 Retirement of John Hume and Seamus Mallon (lodged on 15 November 2001) Irene Oldfather*, Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*, Alasdair Morgan*
